page.description: Opens a text editor. Used to edit memos when user clicks the pencil icon. Returns 'lastbutton' and 'insertion_point'
page.syntax: Button as C = a5_memo_editor(P fp [,C title [,L readonly [,N cursor_position ]]])

argument.name: Button
argument.description: The name of the last button pressed.

argument.name: fp
argument.description: A dot variable with a .Text sub-element.

argument.name: title
argument.description: The title of the Memo Editor. Character

argument.name: readonly
argument.description:
Logical. Optional. Default = .F.
.T. = The text is read only.
.F. = The text can be edited.

argument.name: cursor_position
argument.description: Numeric. Optional. Default = 1. The initial cursor location.

section.description: The A5_MEMO_EDITOR() function displays the Memo Editor. It is a wrapper for A5_MEMO_EDITOR2(). It returns the name of the last button pressed.

section.title: Example
section.description: In this example narrative is the name of a memo field on a form.In this example narrative is the name of a memo field on a form.
section.example: dim response as N response = ui_msg_box("Narrative","Do you want to type/edit a Narrative?", UI_YES_NO) IF (response = UI_YES_SELECTED) THEN choice = a5_memo_editor(narrative.field_get() ) IF choice = "save" then parentform.commit() narrative.refresh() END IF END IF

section.description: This example directly updates the table.
section.example: dim tbl as P dim response as N dim p as P dim p.text as C response = ui_msg_box("Narrative","Do you want to type/edit a Narrative?", UI_YES_NO) IF (response = UI_YES_SELECTED) THEN tbl = table.current() p.text = tbl.narrative choice = a5_memo_editor(p, "Narrative") IF choice = "save" then tbl.change_begin() tbl.narrative = p.text tbl.change_end(.T.) narrative.refresh() END IF END IF
